DataSource.Name: Discount
DataSource.SQL: select 1 as GroupDummy, P.ProductName, Sum(-1 * TI.QtyPaid * SID.DiscountAmount) as Amount from tbSaleItemDiscount SID left join tbSaleItem SI on SI.SaleItemId=SID.SaleItemId left join tbProduct P on P.ProductId=SID.PromoProductId left join tbTransactionItem TI on TI.SaleItemId=SI.SaleItemId left join tbTransaction T on T.TransactionId=TI.TransactionId left join tbWorkstation W on T.WorkstationId=W.WorkstationId left join tbAccount OPA on OPA.AccountId=W.OpAreaAccountId left join tbAccount Loc on Loc.AccountId=W.LocationAccountId where T.TransactionFiscalDate>=:@DateFrom and T.TransactionFiscalDate<=:@DateTo and (:@WorkstationId is null or W.WorkstationId=:@WorkstationId) and (:@OpAreaId is null or W.OpAreaAccountId=:@OpAreaId) and (:@LocationId is null or W.LocationAccountId=:@LocationId) and (:@UserId is null or T.UserAccountId=:@UserId) group by P.ProductName order by P.ProductName

DataSource.Name: Filters
Group
DataSource.SQL: select 1 as GroupDummy, Coalesce(Tag.TagName, 'Undefined') TagName, Sum(TI.QtyPaid * SI.StatAmount) as TotalAmount from tbTransaction T inner join tbTransactionItem TI on T.TransactionId=TI.TransactionId left join tbSaleItem SI on SI.SaleItemId=TI.SaleItemId left join tbProduct P on P.ProductId=SI.ProductId left join tbTag Tag on Tag.TagId=P.FinanceGroupTagId left join tbWorkstation W on T.WorkstationId=W.WorkstationId left join tbAccount OPA on OPA.AccountId=W.OpAreaAccountId left join tbAccount Loc on Loc.AccountId=W.LocationAccountId where T.TransactionFiscalDate>=:@DateFrom and T.TransactionFiscalDate<=:@DateTo and (:@WorkstationId is null or W.WorkstationId=:@WorkstationId) and (:@OpAreaId is null or W.OpAreaAccountId=:@OpAreaId) and (:@LocationId is null or W.LocationAccountId=:@LocationId) and (:@UserId is null or T.UserAccountId=:@UserId) group by Tag.TagName order by Tag.TagName

DataSource.Name: Payment
DataSource.SQL: select 1 as GroupDummy, Coalesce(Tag.TagName, 'Undefined') PaymentGroup, Coalesce(Plg.PluginName, Drv.DriverName) as PaymentMethod, Sum(P.PaymentAmount) as PaymentAmount from tbTransaction T inner join tbPayment P on P.TransactionId=T.TransactionId left join tbPlugin Plg on Plg.PluginId=P.PluginId left join tbPluginPaymentMethod PPM on PPM.PluginId=P.PluginId left join tbDriver Drv on Drv.DriverId=Plg.DriverId left join tbWorkstation W on T.WorkstationId=W.WorkstationId left join tbAccount OPA on OPA.AccountId=W.OpAreaAccountId left join tbAccount Loc on Loc.AccountId=W.LocationAccountId left join tbTag Tag on Tag.TagId=PPM.PaymentGroupTagId where P.PaymentStatus=2 /* Approved */ and T.TransactionFiscalDate>=:@DateFrom and T.TransactionFiscalDate<=:@DateTo and (:@WorkstationId is null or W.WorkstationId=:@WorkstationId) and (:@OpAreaId is null or W.OpAreaAccountId=:@OpAreaId) and (:@LocationId is null or W.LocationAccountId=:@LocationId) and (:@UserId is null or T.UserAccountId=:@UserId) group by Coalesce(Tag.TagName, 'Undefined'), Coalesce(Plg.PluginName, Drv.DriverName) order by PaymentGroup, PaymentMethod

DataSource.Name: Taxes
DataSource.SQL: select 1 as GroupDummy, TX.TaxName, Sum(SIT.TaxAmount * TI.QtyPaid) as Amount from tbSaleItemTax SIT left join tbSaleItem SI on SI.SaleItemId=SIT.SaleItemId left join tbTax TX on TX.TaxId=SIT.TaxId left join tbTransactionItem TI on TI.SaleItemId=SI.SaleItemId left join tbTransaction T on T.TransactionId=TI.TransactionId left join tbWorkstation W on T.WorkstationId=W.WorkstationId left join tbAccount OPA on OPA.AccountId=W.OpAreaAccountId left join tbAccount Loc on Loc.AccountId=W.LocationAccountId where T.TransactionFiscalDate>=:@DateFrom and T.TransactionFiscalDate<=:@DateTo and (:@WorkstationId is null or W.WorkstationId=:@WorkstationId) and (:@OpAreaId is null or W.OpAreaAccountId=:@OpAreaId) and (:@LocationId is null or W.LocationAccountId=:@LocationId) and (:@UserId is null or T.UserAccountId=:@UserId) group by TX.TaxName order by TX.TaxName

DataSource.Name: TransactionDiscount
DataSource.SQL: select 1 as GroupDummy, P.ProductName, Sum(SI.TotalAmount) Amount from tbSaleItem SI left join tbProduct P on P.ProductId=SI.ProductId left join tbPromoRule PR on PR.ProductId= P.ProductId left join tbTransactionItem TI on TI.SaleItemId=SI.SaleItemId left join tbTransaction T on T.TransactionId=TI.TransactionId left join tbWorkstation W on T.WorkstationId=W.WorkstationId left join tbAccount OPA on OPA.AccountId=W.OpAreaAccountId left join tbAccount Loc on Loc.AccountId=W.LocationAccountId where P.ProductType=5 /*PromoRule*/ and PR.PromoActionTarget=1 /*Transaction*/ and PR.PromoDiscountType=2 /*AbsDiscount*/ and T.TransactionFiscalDate>=:@DateFrom and T.TransactionFiscalDate<=:@DateTo and T.Paid<>0 and (:@WorkstationId is null or W.WorkstationId=:@WorkstationId) and (:@OpAreaId is null or W.OpAreaAccountId=:@OpAreaId) and (:@LocationId is null or W.LocationAccountId=:@LocationId) and (:@UserId is null or T.UserAccountId=:@UserId) group by P.ProductName order by P.ProductName

RichDescItem.Description:
Audit Report

Abstract

“Audit Report” generates a report on the Financial Statement within a selected period at your choice filtered by Location, Operating Area, Workstation and User.

Generating the report

Parameter Input
While generating the report, input parameters menu presents an intuitive interface.
Built-in wizards will help you quickly and easily create at your choice profile for your site by:

           [Datasource] – Data source easy-to-select by eligible users (please refer to SnApp BKO >> Templates >> Statistical Reports >> Audit >> Profile)
           [From date – To Date] – Period to be analysed, easy-to-select.
                                                  Note: The dates if not specified are to be considered “Fiscal Date”
           [Location] – Site Location, easy-to-select. When select "-empty", default is all the locations
           [Operating Area] – Operating area, easy-to-select. When select "-empty", default is all the operating areas.
           [User] – Site User Name. When select "-empty", default is all the users
           [Workstation] – Site Workstation Name. When select "-empty", default is all the workstations

Output File Extension
Report generates a PDF (latest version) file

Page Layout

The information generated have the following format:
General:
·         [Report Title] – Report Title "Audit" centered at the top of each page generated.
·         [Execution date/time] - Report Execution Time. Date and Hours format as per configuration [Location, Operating Area, Workstation].as footer on the left side of the page
          [# n] – Page number as footer on the right side of the page.
​          [Footer] Report's execution date and timing
 
Header

·         [DATE:] – Selected analysis period with the following format From Date - To Date (dates are written as the preferred Calendar Date format)
           [LOCATION] – Site Location Code and Name. Display format: "[SITE LOCATION CODE] Site Location Name".Selecting blanck or "- empty" all the  Locations' exposure are analysed and listed
           [OPERATING AREA] – Site Operating Area Code and Name. Display format: "[SITE OPERATING AREA CODE] Site Operating Area Name". Selecting blanck or "- empty" all the  Operating Area' exposure are analysed and listed
           [USER] – Account  User Code and Name. Selecting blanck or "- empty" all the users. Display format: [USER CODE] "Last Name", "First Name"
           [WORKSTATION] – Site Workstation Code and Name. Display format: "[SITE WORKSTATION CODE] Site Workstation Name". Selecting blanck or "- empty" all the Workstation' exposure are analysed and listed

Contents

The program produces easy-to-read reports organized into tables, one for each section as described on the sample table here below:
Section Title
Item A Value expressed in selected currency (i.e. $ 100.00)
Item B Value expressed in selected currency (i.e. $ 1000.00)
Item C Value expressed in selected currency (i.e. $ 100.00)
Total Value expressed in selected currency (i.e. $ 100.00)
 
  • Section Title (centered): Financial Group.
  • Table row: each row is divided in two columns
    • Column 1: Financial Group Name
    • Column 2: Value expressed in selected currency (i.e. $ 100.00)
       
  • Section Title (centered): Tax.
  • Table row: each row is divided in two columns
    • Column 1: Tax Name (VAT, State Tax, County Tax….)
    • Column 2: Value expressed in selected currency (i.e. $ 100.00)
       
  • Section Title (centered): Payment.
  • Table row: each row is divided in two columns regrouped by typology
    • Column 1: Payment Method Name (Bank transfer, Credit Card, Wallet, Web Payment, Cash…)
    • Column 2: Value expressed in selected currency (i.e. $ 100.00)
       
  • Section Title (centered): Item Discounts
  • Table row: each row is divided in two columns regrouped by typology
    • Column 1: Item Discount Name (Coupon, Voucher, Reward Point, Hotel Guest…)
    • Column 2: Value expressed in selected currency (i.e. $ 100.00)
